page.title: 09Landuse
page.content: Today the majority of the island is neglected and overgrown. This makes the island trecherous as the undergrowth conceals many crevices and holes. In the past animals have been kept on the island. In the 16th century French troops were garrisoned there and there horses thrived on the lush grass. In the early 19th century the lightkeeper and his family keep 7 cows on the island. There are no animals kept on the island today but the Principal lightkeeper has managed to successfully cultivate a vegatable garden on the slopes below the lighthouse.
